title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Bookstore
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Bookstore            Bookstore       The bookstore is located in the visitor center and is open during park hours. Books and educational products related to Frederick Douglass, African-American history, slavery, emancipation, the Underground Railroad, and more, are available for purchase.  The bookstore is managed by Eastern National, a cooperating association of the National Park Service. Some merchandise can be purchased through its online store eParks.  Â     The bookstore offers a variety of merchandise related to Frederick Douglass and his era. NPS/Johnson
